unit_learning_outcomes.description: evaluate and analyse performing arts practices in relation to wider social, cultural and artistic contexts.
demonstrate skills of academic writing, analysis, description, communication, conceptualisation and reflection.
identify a variety of performing arts and entertainment industry sectors within an Australian and international context.
communicate and apply skills in a range of contexts.

assessments.description: Individual engagement with course content in both lectures and tutorials will be demonstrated through writing tasks.

Students will demonstrate their knowledge and skills of a particular aspect of the performing arts or entertainment sector that reflects their interest. Students will do this through an individual presentation delivered either live to an audience, or, online via a media presentation. Presentations may include PowerPoint presentations, vodcasts, podcasts and performative formats. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: MMCC1035 - The Performing Arts and Entertainment Industries

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is a broad introduction to the performing arts and entertainment industries across local, national and international contexts. It provides an overview of the subsidised and commercial arts sectors, and contributions the arts and performing arts make in social, cultural, and economic contexts. It covers a wide range of forms within the performing arts and entertainment industries. No prior experience of the field is required.
